column1: Protests and civil unrest against the government of Iran began in Tehran on 16 September 2022 as a reaction to the death of 22-year-old [1] [2], who had been arrested by the Guidance Patrol for wearing an "improper" hijab - in violation of Iran's mandatory hijab law - while visiting Tehran from Saqqez. She had been severely beaten by Guidance Patrol officers, an assertion denied by Iranian authorities.

[1] [1] (unofficially referred to as [2] [2]) was an extremely destructive and strong Atlantic hurricane, as well as the largest Atlantic hurricane on record (2022) as measured by diameter, with tropical-storm-force winds spanning 1,150 miles ([3] km).
column5: The storm inflicted nearly $70 billion (2012 USD) in damage and killed 233 people across eight countries from the Caribbean to Canada.

column1: [1] [1] is a digital image processing technique which combines multiple images taken at different focus distances to give a resulting image with a greater depth of field (DOF) than any of the individual source images.
column5:
Also known as focal plane merging, z-stacking, focus blending
Focus stacking can be used in any situation where individual images have a very shallow depth of field; macro photography and optical microscopy are two typical examples. Focus stacking can also be useful in landscape photography.

column1: The recognition of a spiritual element in landscape art is present from its beginnings in East Asian art, drawing on [1] and other philosophical traditions, but in the West only becomes explicit with [2].
If the primary purpose of a picture is to depict an actual, specific place, especially including buildings prominently, it is called a [1] view.
